text: Hicklin School is a historic one-room school located near Lexington, Lafayette County, Missouri. It was designed by J.H. Felt & Co. and built in 1914. It is a standardized plan, cross-gabled frame building. Also on the property is a contributing two-hole privy. The school closed about 1957. (includes 12 photographs from 2003) It was listed on the National Register of Historic Places in 2004. ==References== Category:One-room schoolhouses in Missouri Category:School buildings on the National Register of Historic Places in Missouri Category:School buildings completed in 1914 Category:Schools in Lafayette County, Missouri Category:National Register of Historic Places in Lafayette County, Missouri
title: Hicklin School
